content.rendered: UNM is a non-profit organization founded in 2002 to respond to the needs of orphan-headed households affected by the genocide and HIV/AIDS. Over time, it has transformed into a child and youth-focused organisation, with a mission to strengthen family cohesion, provide care for vulnerable children, promote economic empowerment for youth, and support mental health wellness.

excerpt.rendered: UNM is an NGO in Rwanda that cared for vulnerable children, including orphans impacted by genocide/HIV/AIDS and girls affected by violence. It collaborates with communities to provide safe and supportive environments, this later become a child and youth focused organization to improve and sustain  their social- economic and mental health well being.
